results.title: A story of boys and girls = Storia di ragazzi e di ragazze
results.creator_credit: Antonio Avati, Duea Film, RAIUNO and Pupi Avati
results.brief_description: Angelo, who is from a rich family in Bologna, is engaged to the very beautiful Silvia who is the daughter of peasants in the Italian countryside. To celebrate the engagement, Angelo and Silvia’s families are to come together for a grand lunch at the home of her parents. As the wine flows and the sumptious meal is consumed, family secrets and resentments come to the surface and threaten the young couple’s happiness. Set in the thirties, the rigid codes which govern peasant life are already beginning to become undone: Mussolini is beginning his ascendancy; the dictates of family honour and fidelity are being defied; the centuries old division between poor and the rich is being questioned. But for Angelo and Silvia, caught up in the passion of their love, everything else is secondary. Charming, comic and beautifully filmed “A Story of Boys and Girls” is a rewarding film about the ties of love, family and honour; a film about the last moment in a young nation’s life where it knew peace before the advent of a World War which would tear it apart.

results.title: A Stone in the bush
results.creator_credit: John Allen, Martyn Sanderson, Michael Glasheen and Zzoommovies
results.brief_description: An experimental film giving an impression of the making of the feature film “Ned Kelly” on location near Bungendore, New South Wales, in 1969. Shows the director and stars (including Mick Jagger) working in various locations, accompanied only by the music of the Rolling Stones.

results.title: A Stitch in time
results.creator_credit: Hugh Stewart, Rank Organisation Film Productions and Robert Asher
results.brief_description: Norman Wisdom was famed for his ability to combine pathos and slapstick. In this motion picture he is an assistant to local butcher Mr. Grimsdale. During a hold up, Norman persuades Mr. Grimsdale to hide his gold watch in his mouth. This foolproof strategy comes unstuck when the watch is swallowed and Grimsdale has to be taken to hospital. Once there Norman is able to wreak havoc and chaos amongst patients and staff alike, but eventually his lovable charm wins the day and he manages to come out on top. Also stars Edward Chapman, Jerry Desmond and Lucy Appleby.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hugh Stewart, Rank Organisation Film Productions and Robert Asher

results.title: A Step from the shadows
results.creator_credit: James Michael, Russell Manning Productions and Gary Lindberg
results.brief_description: Two children hear their parents arguing. The mother, an alcoholic, will not admit that she has a problem. Eventually her husband goes to a doctor who suggests possible ways of tackling the illness. The first attempt at rehabilitation fails, but finally, after admitting that she is ill, she appears to be on the way to controlling her disease.

results.title: A state of illiteracy
results.brief_description: This program focuses on the state of illiteracy in Australia. It examines the reasons why people may be illiterate and the ways in which they cope with illiteracy in today’s society. The stigma of illiteracy (the assumption that to be illiterate is to be mentally deficient) is explored. Interviews with illiterate people from different sectors of the community are conducted and adult literacy courses are also examined. Presented by Margaret Throsby.

results.title: A State funeral for Alec Campbell: the last Anzac
results.creator_credit: Tracey Smith, ABC-TV (Australia) and Greg Simson
results.brief_description: Described as charming, determined but also quite humble, a man of peace, widely respected and with many friends, Alec Campbell (1899-2002) was affectionately remembered as the last Anzac. He was born in Launceston, Tasmania, educated at Scotch College, Launceston and at the tender age of sixteen, successfully enlisted (by lying about his age) in the Army, in the 15th Battalion headed for Gallipoli. His time spent in Gallipoli was very brief - 2 months as a water carrier, but Alec has become part of the Anzac legend, however reluctantly, and on his passing on 16 May 2002 was given the honour of a State funeral as the last Anzac who fought in Gallipoli. This video is of the television broadcast of Alec Campbell’s State Funeral Service which was held at the Cathedral Church of Saint David in Hobart, Tasmania on Friday 24 May 2002. Hosted by Judy Tierney, Peter Gee and Lt. Col. John Moore, the program begins with a portrait of Alec Campbell’s life and achievements through interviews with his family and including stills, archival newsreel footage and family photos. This is then followed by a complete broadcast of the funeral service. A great tribute to a man who perhaps was somewhat bewildered by all the fuss and attention he received in his final years - a gentle man.

results.title: A Star named Ayrton Senna
results.creator_credit: Jean-Claude Guiter, Instituto Ayrton Senna and FOCA
results.brief_description: A Star Named Ayrton Senna is an insightful and intimate documentary about the Brazilian Formula 1 Champion who died tragically in May 1994. Includes interviews with Senna’s relatives and friends as well as people he worked with in the Grand Prix circuit. Fans of Ayrton Senna the man and also Formula One will enjoy the many frank interviews with Senna, as well as footage of him racing (including his days of racing Go-Carts!) and also his normal life away from the Grand Prix hysteria. Senna’s views on life and his professionalism are beautifully presented and the documentary also gives an interesting insight into the stresses and strains of fame. In English and Portugese with English subtitles.
